info.title: Credit Sense API
info.description:
The Credit Sense API allows you to:
- Create, manage, and send quick links.
- Grant access permissions for applications to another Store.
- Manage refresh authorities and trigger refreshes on existing applications.
- Provide transaction data that we'll use to generate Credit Sense reports.
- Retrieve existing Credit Sense reports.
- Retrieve statistics on the number of applications completed.
- Retrieve statuses and metadata for applications.
- View and manage blacklisted applications.
# Authentication
Each call to the API requires:
- **API key** - identifies your account; forms part of the request URL (https://api.creditsense.com.au/v2/{api-key}/{endpoint}).
- **API token** - identifies your access to the API; included in the `Settings` object in your request body.

If you don't have your API credentials or you'd like them to be changed, please [contact us](mailto:support@creditsense.com.au).
# Rate Limiting
Connections to the API are limited to a maximum of ten (10) per minute. A 429 response code will be returned for API calls that exceed the limit.

api-key.description: The unique key that identifies your account.

App_ID.description: Our unique identifier for the new refresh application.

App_Ref.description:
Your reference assigned to the new refresh application. 
If your reference is not unique within the Store, we will append the refresh date and time to make the reference unique.

Your reference assigned to the new refresh application.
If your reference is unique within the Store, this will match the `App_Ref`.

Is_New_App.description: Denotes whether the refresh was processed as a priority.

Existing_App_ID.description: Our unique identifier for the existing application that was refreshed.

Refresh_Date.description: The date and time the new refresh application was created.

post.description:
Trigger a refresh for one or more existing applications.

In order to refresh the application successfully, the following requirements must be met:

1. Valid API key and Token.
2. Valid application ID provided.
3. The Store of the refresh application needs to have a refresh Store assigned.
4. The application needs a valid and active refresh authority.
5. The Client of the refresh application needs to have a valid provider (e.g. Yodlee v12).
6. The credential of the refresh application doesn't require MFA verification.

When an application is refreshed as a priority, it will be processed first in the queue. Each Client has a certain number of applications which can be set as priority. If the number of priority applications reaches the limit, the system will ignore the "priority" settings and refresh the application as normal priority. The refresh limit can be defined at a Store level.

If the refresh is triggered on a completed application, the system will create a new application, otherwise, it will refresh the existing application.

Once a refresh is completed, an email and/or webhook call may be made, dependent on the Client and Store settings.

For code snippets to assist with your implementation, check out our [help docs](https://docs.creditsense.com.au).

API_Token.description: The unique token that identifies your API access privileges.

Raise_Error.description:
The error code you specify will be returned in the response. 
This is used for testing purposes only.

App_ID.description: Our unique identifier for the application to be refreshed.

New_App_Ref.description: Your reference assigned to the new application. If not provided, your reference from the  original application will be used with "\_refresh" appended to it.

Is_priority.description:
If set to true, the refresh will be processed as a priority.
Each Store has a limit of priority applications in the queue. By default, the Store queue limit is set to 10.

Copy_Existing_Data.description:
If set to true, the existing application will be copied to the Refresh store *without* triggering an actual refresh (i.e. no new bank pull will occur). 
This is usually only used in specific circumstances.

No_Delivery.description:
If set to true, the configured delivery methods (e.g. email, webhook, etc.) on the store will be ignored for the refresh. 
This can be useful if you intend to poll the `/app/search` endpoint to monitor the status of the application. 
This is usually only used in specific circumstances and may be used in conjunction with `Copy_Existing_Data`.

Error_Message.example: 402 - Incorrect internet banking username or password
enum: 401 - The request timed out before completing due to delays beyond our control - Customer should retry in a few minutes.
402 - Incorrect internet banking username or password
403 - There is a problem retrieving information from the customers internet banking. Please submit a ticket with us so we can resolve this. The bank statement will need to be retrieved manually.

404 - Temporary technical difficulties are causing a problem, fetching the bank statement is failing after logging in. The customer can try again as this is temporary however please also log a ticket with us for investigation.
405 - The request cannot be completed because the request was canceled. The customer may have logged into their banking site at the same time. Please ask the customer to try again.
406 - The customers password has expired with their internet banking site. They will have to change the password and try again.
407 - The customer's bank account is locked and cant be logged into.
408 - It appears the customers accounts are not linked to their internet banking. Please have the customer link their accounts to their internet banking and then try again.
409 - Internet Banking site has errored after verifying login, this is usually a temporary error. If the problem is persisting, please log a ticket for escalation.
ing - Customer should retry in a few minutes.
413 - There is a problem retrieving information from the customers internet banking. Please submit a ticket with us so we can resolve this. The bank statement will need to be retrieved manually.
414 - The customers banking site says the requested account was not found at the site.
415 - The request cannot be completed due to technical difficulties at the internet banking site.
416 - The request cannot be completed as another attempt to login to their internet banking was already established at the same time.
419 - Unexpected changes to the banks site. Please ask the customer to supply manually, this problem should be resolved in a few days.
422 - We were unable to retrieve the account information because it appears one or more of the related accounts have been closed.
424 - Internet Banking site is showing a maintenance window message, the customer will need to wait till the maintenance is complete to continue.
428 - The customers banking site requires that the consumer accept new terms and conditions. After this has been accepted re-run this application.

429 - The internet banking site is requesting an update of personal information thats blocking the statement collection process, Please ask the customer to log in and resolve before attempting a new application.
470 - The request cannot be completed because the payee site requires that the consumer contact customer support.
505 - We do not currently support the security system used by this bank, we apologise for any inconvenience.
507 - This bank is in beta, Yodlee is providing data updates for this bank but it is not out of beta and reports are not completing successfully yet.
508 - The request timedout when processing, the customer should retry.
509 - The customers banking site says information provided is no longer valid at the site.
518 - The required additional authentication information was unavailable. Please try again.
520 - Authentication Information Incorrect: The additional authentication information provided is incorrect. Please retry.
522 - Request has timedout at our data provider, please try to run again.
523 - We're sorry, the authentication information you provided is incorrect. Please try again.
525 - The request timedout when processing, the customer should retry.
801 - This is an intermittent issue with our data provider. Please ask the customer to try again, if the problem persists please lodge a ticket.
802 - This is an intermittent issue with our data provider. Please ask the customer to try again, if the problem persists please lodge a ticket.
1000 - The request timed out when processing, the customer should retry.
1001 - The request timed out when processing, the customer should retry.
1002 - The request timed out when processing, the customer should retry.
1003 - The request timed out when processing, the customer should retry.

Create_Dt.description: The date and time the application was created.

Modify_Dt.description: The date and time the application was modified.

Client_Name.description: Denotes the Store object for the retrieved report.

Client_Code.description: The unique code to identify the Store.

Centrelink_Status.description: Denotes the status for myGov or WINZ supporting documents.

Refresh_Authority.description: The refresh authority object of the application. If there's no refresh authority for the application, the object will have a `NULL` value.

Is_Active.description: Denotes whether the refresh authority is active for the application.

Is_Revoke_By_Customer.description: Denotes whether the customer has revoked the refresh authority for the application.

Revoke_Dt.description: Denotes the date and time the customer revoked the refresh authority.

Create_Dt.description: Denotes the creation date and time of the refresh authority.

End_Dt.description: Denotes the expiration date and time of the refresh authority.

Current_Dt.description: Denotes the current date and time for the server when the response was generated. To get a list of all applications that have changed since this call, pass the `Current_Dt` value in as `the `From` date in your call.

Last_App_Dt.description: Denotes the modification date and time of the most recent application that matches the search criteria.

Count.description: Denotes the number of applications included in the response.

Total.description: Denotes the total number of applications that match the search criteria.

Success.description: Denotes whether the search was successfully executed.

Error_Code.description: The code that identifies the error.

Error_Type.description: Denotes the type of error encountered.

enum: Invalid date format. ISO 8601 Standard dates must be provided.
We are unable to connect to the database at this time

post.description:
Retrieve applications that match the specified search criteria. 

Common reasons to use this endpoint:
- Monitor for completed applications via periodic polling (as an alternative to or in conjunction with asynchronous Webhooks).
- Check the status of an in-progress application based on the application ID or reference.
- Check for failed/errored applications.

This endpoint is synchronous and will always return an immediate response.

### Date format
Dates included in your request for this endpoint are expected in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format. i.e. `yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss.fff T`

| Portion | Example | Description                                                |
|---------|---------|------------------------------------------------------------|
| yyyy    | 2016    | The full year                                              |
| MM      | 04      | The month, with leading zeros                              |
| dd      | 08      | The day, with leading zeros                                |
| hh      | 16      | Hours (24 hour time), with leading zeros                   |
| mm      | 45      | Minutes, with leading zeros                                |
| ss      | 53      | Seconds, with leading zeros                                |
| .fff    | .654300 | Factions of a second, 6 decimal places with trailing zeros |
| T       | +10:00  | The timezone offset                                        |

**Notes:**
- If you provide your local time, make sure you include your timezone offset.
- Dates will be returned in UTC.
- Although ISO standard dates support providing only the date portion, to avoid confusion it is recommended you always pass full date and time for the `Date_Range.To` object. If no time is provided, the default `00:00:00.000000` time is assumed.

### Pagination
A maximum of 500 results will be returned for calls to this endpoint. If you receive a `Total` that is larger than the `Count`, you should repeat the call but with `Date_Range.From` set to the returned `Last_App_Dt`, to get the rest of the applications. You may need to do this multiple times to get all of the available applications.

### Duplicate applications
It is possible to receive the same application in different date ranges. It's important that you handle this accordingly.

There are two reasons this happens: 
1. When applications are changed in some way, their `Modify_Dt` will change, making them applicable for different date ranges. 
2. If your search returns more than the maximum number of results, when the results are returned paginated you may have the last application of your _first_ call appear as the first of your _second_ call. See the example below.

#### Example
| App | Modify_Dt | Returned in    |
|-----|-----------|----------------|
| A   | 1         | Call 1         |
| B   | 2         | Call 1         |
| C   | 2         | Call 1         |
| D   | 2         | Call 1         |
| E   | 3         | Call 1, Call 2 |
| F   | 3         |         Call 2 |
| G   | 4         |         Call 2 |

**Call 1 response** `Count: 5, Total: 7, Last_App_Date: 3`

**Call 2 request** `Date_Range.From: 3` | **Call 2 response** `Count: 3, Total: 3, Last_App_Date: 4`

API_Token.description: The unique token that identifies your API access privileges.

The error code you specify will be returned in the response. 
This is used for testing purposes only.

App_ID.description: Our unique identifiers for the applications.

Status.description: The statuses to filter the applications by.

Client_Code.description: Allows limiting of results by Store codes.

From.description: Allows limiting of results to those applications modified after this date.

To.description: Allows limiting of results to those applications modified before this date.

ThisDay.description: Denotes the number of applications today.

PrevDay.description: Denotes the number of applications yesterday.

ThisWeek.description: Denotes the number of applications from Monday until now.

PrevWeek.description: Denotes the number of applications Monday and Sunday last week.

ThisMonth.description: Denotes the number of applications this calendar month so far.

PrevMonth.description: Denotes the number of applications last calendar month.

Total.description: Denotes the total number of applications for all time.

FirstDate.description: Denotes the date of the oldest application.

LastDate.description: Denotes the date of the most recent application.

Success.description: Denotes whether statistics were successfully retrieved.

Error_Code.description: The code that identifies the error.

Error_Type.description: Denotes the type of error encountered.

Error_Description.example: Invalid API_Key or API_Token

Token.description: Our token that identifies the quick link.

Message.description: The portion of the URL following `https://creditsense.com.au/` once the quick link is expanded.

Create_Date.description: The date and time the quick link was created.

Expire_Date.description: The date and time the quick link is scheduled to expire.

Is_Expired.description: Denotes whether the quick link has expired.

Is_Emailed.description: Denotes whether the quick link has been emailed.

Is_Clicked.description: Denotes whether the quick link has been clicked.

Store_Code.description: The unique code to identify the Store.

App_ID.description: Our unique identifier for the application.

Notify_Name.description: The name provided when the quick link was created.

Notify_Email.description: The email address provided when the quick link was created.

Notify_Mobile.description: The mobile/cell number provided when the quick link was created.

Notify_Email_Status.description: Indicates the current status of the quick link email.

Notify_Mobile_Status.description: Indicates the current status of the quick link SMS.

Error_Code.description: The code that identifies the error.

Error_Type.description: Denotes the type of error encountered.

Error_Description.example: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error.

Error_Description.example: Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

The error code you specify will be returned in the response.

post.description: Create a quick link.

API_Token.description: The unique token that identifies your API access privileges.

Raise_Error.description:
The error code you specify will be returned in the response. 
This is used for testing purposes only.

App_reference.description: Your reference for the quick link.

Store_Code.description: Denotes the Store the quick link will be generated in.

Bank_ID.description: Denotes the default bank for the quick link.

Is_Centrelink_Required.description: Denotes whether to the customer will be required to provide myGov or WINZ credentials to retrieve supporting docs.

Is_Unique_Reference.description:
Denotes whether your reference for the quick link is unique.
If set to false, your reference will be used with the date and time of the application appended to it.

Is_Link_To_Existing_App.description: Denotes that an application with your reference already exists in an incomplete state, and this quick link is related to that existing application.

tags.name: General
tags.description: Search for applications, download reports, get stats, and transfer ownership of an app.

tags.name: Quick links
tags.description: Create, manage, and send quick links.

tags.name: Refresh
tags.description: Manage refresh authorities and trigger refreshes on existing applications.

tags.name: Credit Sense Analysis Service (CSAS)
tags.description: Provide transaction data that we'll use to generate Credit Sense reports.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Automatically receive reports as soon as they're generated.
